intro: Codonoboea urticoides, commonly known as the stinging nettle plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, often stinging leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves contain irritant chemicals that cause a tingling sensation upon contact with the skin. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
